type: Lab Equipment and Supplies, Laboratory and Scientific Equipment
short_summary: Supply of a Bioanalyzer 2100 instrument and associated equipment for the Natural Resources Canada
description: The Natural Resources Canada requires the supply of one (1) Bioanalyzer 2100 instrument at the Pacific Forestry Centre (PFC) in Victoria, BC, along with a laptop with 2100 Expert compatible software and an instrument control licence. The Bioanalyzer will be used for rapid assessment of RNA integrity, which is needed to determine whether RNA samples can be processed for sequencing or other processes.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

**Public Notice**

## Project Title and Details
### Title: Bioanalyzer 2100 Instrument Supply
The Department of Public Works and Government Services on behalf of the Department of Natural Resources Canada is soliciting bids for the supply of one (1) Bioanalyzer 2100 instrument.

## Tender Details
* Tender Reference Number: WS4213811203-Doc4319085966
* Tender ID: #WS4213811203
* Tender Closing Date: December 13, 2023, at 14:00 (Eastern Standard Time)
* Expected Contract Start Date: None
* Expected Contract End Date: May 31, 2024
* Procurement Category: Goods
* Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN)
* Solicitation Method: The contract award will be based on the lowest-ranked bid.

## Goods and Services Requested
The successful bidder shall provide one (1) Bioanalyzer 2100 instrument, a laptop with 2100 Expert compatible software, and an instrument control license.

## Location and Regions
* Project Location: Pacific Forestry Centre, Victoria, British Columbia
* Trade Agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

## Contact Information
For any inquiries, please contact:
Radunz, Vanessa (SPAC/PSPC)
Phone: None
Email: [vanessa.radunz@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:vanessa.radunz@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

# Important Links
* Tender Notice: [https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18131663](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18131663)
* Contact Details: Contact Vanessa Radunz at the above email address for further information. 

Note: A birder has to submit their name in the email when submitting their bid.
